dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so, uh, another wild ride in the markets yesterday, wouldn't you say?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so, uh, another wild ride in the markets yesterday, wouldn't you say?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely, [overlapping] a pretty significant downturn, actually. The Dow, S&P, Nasdaq, all taking a hit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely, a pretty significant downturn, actually. The Dow, S P, Nasdaq, all taking a hit.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Dow Jones industrial average soared 420 points, or 1.4%, Wednesday, while the S&P 500, which broke a five-day losing streak on Tuesday, and the tech-heavy Nasdaq climbed 1.1% and 1%, respectively.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I saw that. Dow plummeting over 400 points. But, like, here's what's interesting: it said "technological downturn," but then Apple, Amazon, Facebook, they all actually *rose* a bit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I saw that. Dow plummeting over four hundred points. But, like, here's what's interesting: it said technological downturn, but then Apple, Amazon, Facebook, they all actually rose a bit.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Dow Jones industrial average soared 420 points, or 1.4%, Wednesday... Technology stocks, on the other hand, continued to slip: Apple, Amazon and Facebook all fell close to 1% Wednesday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right? It's kind of counter-intuitive. While the overall market felt that, uh, pressure from Fed Chair Powell's comments, some of the big tech giants, they seemed to hold their own, or even gain.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? It's kind of counter-intuitive. While the overall market felt that, uh, pressure from Fed Chair Powell's comments, some of the big tech giants, they seemed to hold their own, or even gain.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Technology stocks, on the other hand, continued to slip: Apple, Amazon and Facebook all fell close to 1% Wednesday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But then you had, like, Fisker Inc., the Tesla rival, just completely tank, almost 40% down. What was that about?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then you had, like, Fisker Inc., the Tesla rival, just completely tank, almost forty percent down. What was that about?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Elsewhere in the market, Tesla rival Fisker Inc. soared nearly 40%, surpassing a record high from November, after announcing a collaboration with Taiwanese manufacturer Foxconn on a new electric vehicle project.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that was after they announced they're ending their collaboration with Foxconn on an EV project. Sounds like it just didn't work out.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that was after they announced they're ending their collaboration with Foxconn on an E V project. Sounds like it just didn't work out.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...after announcing a collaboration with Taiwanese manufacturer Foxconn on a new electric vehicle project.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oof. And energy firms too, like Occidental and EOG, huge drops for them. The S&P 500 Energy Index is down, like, 27% this year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oof. And energy firms too, like Occidental and E O G, huge drops for them. The S P five hundred Energy Index is down, like, twenty seven percent this year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Energy firms continued to head up market gains, with Occidental Petroleum, EOG Resources and Cabot Oil & Gas up 8%, 7% and 6%, respectively; the S&P 500 Energy Index has soared 27% this yearmore than double the return of any other sector over the same period.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Massively down. But then, on the flip side, we have Square. They soared like 7%.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Massively down. But then, on the flip side, we have Square. They soared like seven percent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Shares of payments fintech Square, meanwhile, sank about 7% after the firm disclosed in a better-than-expected fourth-quarter earnings report that it has doubled down on a $50 million bitcoin investment from October, purchasing $170 million more of the worlds largest cryptocurrency since.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah, [overlapping] the payments company. I saw that! Was that because of their earnings?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah, the payments company. I saw that! Was that because of their earnings?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Partially, yes. Better-than-expected fourth-quarter earnings, but also, interestingly, they, uh, disclosed they've decreased their Bitcoin investment. Sold off a bunch.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Partially, yes. Better-than-expected fourth-quarter earnings, but also, interestingly, they, uh, disclosed they've decreased their Bitcoin investment. Sold off a bunch.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...it has doubled down on a $50 million bitcoin investment from October, purchasing $170 million more of the worlds largest cryptocurrency since.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, selling off Bitcoin helped them? That's... that's a turn.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, selling off Bitcoin helped them? That's... that's a turn.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, well, investors seemed to like it. And speaking of the Fed, Powell was out there saying monetary policy wouldn't be accommodative.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, well, investors seemed to like it. And speaking of the Fed, Powell was out there saying monetary policy wouldn't be accommodative.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, who insisted Tuesday that monetary policy would remain accommodative despite inflationary concerns.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, downplaying deflation concerns, and then stocks just tanked right after.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, downplaying deflation concerns, and then stocks just tanked right after.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Originally down in early morning trading, stocks surged after Fed Chair Powell downplayed inflation concerns before the House Financial Services Committee on Wednesday...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: I know! But then you have analysts like Craig Erlam from Oanda saying we're in a "very stable period." [chuckles]
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I know! But then you have analysts like Craig Erlam from Oanda saying we're in a very stable period.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Were going through a very choppy period in the markets, with investors uncertain how to read the movements were seeing in bond markets, Oanda Senior Market Analyst Craig Erlam said Wednesday morning.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A "stable period" after that kind of day? That's, uh, interesting phrasing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A stable period after that kind of day? That's, uh, interesting phrasing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, he's saying investors are thrilled about the prospect of lower inflation, and the curve is flattening. He anticipates policymakers might take a more aggressive stance on inflation this year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, he's saying investors are thrilled about the prospect of lower inflation, and the curve is flattening. He anticipates policymakers might take a more aggressive stance on inflation this year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The curve is steepening, and investors are fretting a little about the prospect of higher inflation. ... He expects they may have a more relaxed approach to inflation than in the past.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hmm. So, possibly a steady year, but with, like, no real big rallies?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hmm. So, possibly a steady year, but with, like, no real big rallies?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This may make for a jumpy year in the markets, with any signs of inflation seeing jitters quickly return and any rallies to stall, just as were experiencing at the moment, he notes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's his take, yeah. And, uh, on the Bitcoin front again, MicroStrategy, still going strong. They spent a *billion* dollars to buy more Bitcoin.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's his take, yeah. And, uh, on the Bitcoin front again, MicroStrategy, still going strong. They spent a billion dollars to buy more Bitcoin.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Publicly traded MicroStrategy, one of the largest corporate bitcoin investors, said Wednesday morning it spent approximately $1 billion to acquire 19,452 more bitcoin tokens.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A billion! Even with prices fluctuating so much? That's, um, quite the commitment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A billion! Even with prices fluctuating so much? That's, um, quite the commitment.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. So, lots to watch, as always. Seems like, uh, we're in for a very interesting year in the markets.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. So, lots to watch, as always. Seems like, uh, we're in for a very interesting year in the markets.
